turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Red-eared firetail.
turn.1: What is the colour of the Red-eared firetail's tail?
turn.2: The colour of the tail feathers is a dusky shade of brown with fine black barring and the central tail feathers become crimson toward the coverts.
turn.3: what are the colours of its body?
turn.4: Descriptions of the iris are as red or dark brown, the eye-ring as pale blue, and the legs as dark- or pink-brown.
turn.6: The bill of both sexes is red, although a coating on the bill of the male intensifies its colour during the breeding season.
turn.7: what is the length of an adult?
turn.8: The average size of the adult is around 125 millimetres (mm) in length.
turn.10: The weight of males is 11.4–16.0 grams, females have a narrower range of 12.5–13.6 grams.
turn.11: what are the dimensions of its body?
turn.12: Using a sample of thirty males and fifteen females, the average length in of the wing is 56.2 mm, bill 11.8 mm, tail 43.7 mm, and tarsus 17.0 mm for the male; the female has an average length of wing at 56.4 mm, bill 11.6 mm, tail 42.4 mm, and tarsus 17.4 mm.
